job_description:
S&P Global Market Intelligence

Important Note

After submitting the application, you will be redirected to complete the Pymetrics test. It is mandatory to complete this assessment test.

Kindly take care of below while attempting the screening questions during application submission
• Relocation - "Yes" if you’re nonlocal to the given position location and "Not Applicable" if you’re local to the position location
• "Yes" if you are willing to work in rotational shifts (including night shifts as per business requirement)

The Role: Data Analyst

The location: Gurgaon / Hyderabad

The Team

The Team of Data Analyst’s work on various research reports and company documents to collect information & generate meaningful consensus from the collected data. This effort is coupled with real time monitoring of global industry trade publications and websites/news aggregators. Different Team supports the below & many more business lines:

Transactions (Mergers & Acquisitions), Public Ownership, Private Equity & Investment Management- The Private Equity and Advisory Profiles Team primarily focuses on maintaining and updating profiles of Private Equity and Venture Capital firms. With global coverage, we aim to deliver research, content, and analytics about the public and private capital markets to investment banks, investment managers and alternative investment firms. The team also establishes relationships with Private Equity Firms to gather rare insights about public & private investments, exits, and investment strategies. This effort is coupled with our real time monitoring of global industry trade publications and websites/news aggregators to cover and track all public/private investment markets.

The Impact

We provide highest quality content that is essential for our clients to make decisions with conviction. As a Data Analyst, you will support the integrity and comprehensiveness of the data set by utilizing internal & external public research sources such as government & regulatory documents, stock exchanges, industry journals, analyst reports and our internal research tools to collect, summarize, and synthesize relevant information.

What’s In It For You

With exciting learning opportunities at its core, we'll help you focus on building the essential skills needed for a successful and meaningful transition into the professional world.

This position is an excellent steppingstone to understand the global market dynamism, that will allow you to gain a comprehensive understanding of the market and enable you to learn the various facets of the assigned industry. Once strong fundamental understanding of the dataset and proficiency at workflows is developed, this role would require working with new talent to develop/enhance your skillset and working on process improvement projects including LEAN/automation projects.

Responsibilities
• High quality data (Financial / Non-Financial Data) collation, analysis, extraction and entering the data in work tools as per guideline specifications for assigned vertical
• Understand the working of the dataset, be aware of the workflows and have strong working knowledge of work tools
• Providing input and ideas for new collection methods and product enhancements related to the dataset
• Deliver on predefined individual and team targets including delivering outcomes with quality and excellence.
• Create tech expertise within department
• Troubleshoots problems or issues and support team in enhancing the workflow/processes for department
• Reviewing feedback involving transactions content to help correct errors and establish or refine procedures and processes to improve accuracy

What We’re Looking For
• MBA (Finance as major Specialization) fresher candidates with good academic track record
• Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
• Knowledge of corporate finance / accountancy i.e., financial statements and annual reports
• Well versed with secondary research sources
• Willing to work in 24*5 environment on rotational shifts
• Certification or knowledge/experience in MS-office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
• Strong quantitative, analytical, and interpretive skills
• Ability to conduct efficient thematic online research

About Company Statement

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.

S&P Global Market Intelligence partners with customers to broaden their perspective and operate with confidence by bringing them leading data sources and technologies that embed insight in their daily work.

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. 

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

Job ID: 286977

Posted On: 2023-05-05

Location: Gurgaon, Haryana, India

If you have knowledge and experience with Identity & Access Management (IAM), Security, and IT Operations this is a terrific opportunity to help deliver safe, secure, and reliable IT services to Shell’s end users.

Where you fit in

The Enterprise Technology Services & Operations Management (ET SOM) is responsible for secure and reliable operations of all common Enterprise IT services. Within ETSOM, Identity & Security SOM is responsible for Identity, Access & Security related services to Shell users, business partners and Shell clients. With continuous service changes, interruptions and new services onboarding, I&S is a highly dynamic and motivated global group (60-70 FTE) of IT professionals. As Data Analyst, you will support multiple services within the Identity & Security SOM, Stakeholders include I&S SOM, Identity Domain Natural Teams, ETP / Portfolio management, & Project delivery, PPC, IT Architecture, IRM and several other service suppliers with a strong focus on the services in the Identity & Federation pillar.

What's the role

The Data Analyst is responsible for
• Developing and implementing and operating daily data quality checks and controls to ensure the integrity of the data.
• Creating and managing complex SQL queries and stored procedures to extract, transform, and load data from various sources, and ensure data accuracy and consistency.
• Developing and maintaining automated data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks to ensure accurate and timely data processing
• Communicating findings and insights to stakeholders through Power BI reports dashboards, and presentations.
• Collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making and support business initiatives.
• Continuous monitoring and improving data processes and procedures to ensure optimal efficiency and accuracy.
• Working with appropriate parties for BC incident resolution, documenting solutions to known errors to expedite resolution of incidents and performing root cause analysis to minimize reoccurrence.
• Assisting projects in operational readiness activities. This includes analyzing and understanding business functional and non-functional requirements for supportability impact, as well as assessing implications of landscape and portfolio changes)
• Working with the Domain Natural team, Service Owners, and Architects to improve product features, process flow reliability and security (e.g. perform reviews of the landscapes for enhancement and continuous improvement opportunities).

What we need from you

Aside from your personal skills, business communication skills, and experience in IAM, IT Operations, and IT security, you will make all the difference in this role.
• A graduate with a bachelor's degree preferably in IT and with at least 3 to 5 years of experience of corporate IT experience in Identity & Access Management
• Experience with analyzing large datasets using Advanced MS Excel, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, and Strong SQL skills to identify trends and patterns, and provide insights to inform business decisions.
• Knowledge of and/or experience with managing complicated IT landscapes, including multi-tier architectures, application security, monitoring & storage systems and a clear understanding of application integration with security protocols that adhere to a rigorous IT security baseline.
• Experience in applications support and support processes, specifically ITIL with expertise in Change/release management including automation of Deployment and Configuration (CI/CD)
• Knowledge of Shell’s Enterprise Data Layer Platform(EDPL) would be an added advantage
• Knowledge of or working experience with PingID or other authentication software
• Knowledge of Customer Identity Access Management
• Have strong stakeholder, interpersonal relationships, and negotiation skills. Strong relationship and influencing skills to work with multiple (senior) stakeholders across organizational and business boundaries at all levels, including suppliers. You’ll need to be a proactive problem-solver and strong communicator as you’ll need to communicate to a wide range of stakeholders in IT and the business. This role is a hands-on role which requires a can-do mentality to get things done. The same applies when it comes to providing guidance and coaching to internal teams/supplier/vendor
• Are a Self-starter with strong analytical, problem solving and coordination skills – proactive, thinking in solutions and delivering results. You must be able to identify and analyse operational dependencies across different solutions and service aspects
• Experience with IT project management, coordination, or participation (including AGILE & DevOps methodologies) throughout the Development, Test, Staging and Post-Production phases as well as knowledge of and/or experience with Operational Readiness for new demand, changes and projects impacting the portfolio and providing sign off with Agreement to Deploy and Agreement to Operate as key milestones.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Shell is a global energy company where we work towards powering progress through more and cleaner energy solutions. We use advanced technologies and take an innovative approach to help build a sustainable energy future. In India Shell has its businesses footprint in Information Technology, Projects & Technology, Finance Operations, Integrated Gas, Downstream & Upstream spread across more than 7 main locations.

An innovative place to work

There’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell. Everyone here is helping solve one of the biggest challenges facing the world today: bringing the benefits of energy to everyone on the planet, whilst managing the risks of climate change.

Join us and you’ll add your talent and imagination to a business with the power to shape the future – whether by investing in renewables, exploring new ways to store energy or developing technology that helps the world to use energy more efficiently.

An inclusive place to work

To power progress together, we need to attract and develop the brightest minds and make sure every voice is heard. Here are just some of the ways we’re nurturing an inclusive environment – one where you can express your ideas, extend your skills and reach your potential.

We’re creating a space, where people with disabilities can excel through transparent recruitment process, workplace adjustments and ongoing support in their roles. Feel free to let us know about your circumstances when you apply, and we’ll take it from there.

We’re closing the gender gap – whether that’s through action on equal pay or by enabling more women to reach senior roles in engineering and technology.

We’re striving to be a pioneer of an inclusive and diverse workplace, promoting equality for employees regardless of sexual orientation or gender identity.

We consider ourselves a flexible employer and want to support you finding the right balance. We encourage you to discuss this with us in your application.

A rewarding place to work

Combine our creative, collaborative environment and global operations with an impressive range of benefits and joining Shell becomes an inspired career choice.

We’re huge advocates for career development. We’ll encourage you to try new roles and experience new settings. By pushing people to reach their potential, we frequently help them find skills they never knew they had, or make career moves they never thought possible.

S&P Global Market Intelligence

Job ID: 286974
Posted On: 2023-05-05
Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India

Labcorp is looking for an exceptional Data Analyst to join the Marketing team and help augment its capability in Market and Customer Analytics to further the utility of data assets towards business insight. This role will be an integral member of a growing team that is responsible for data-driven insights to inform marketing strategies, answer business questions, and help Labcorp better serve our customers.
Located in Bangalore, India, this role will be responsible for accessing/organizing and analyzing a diverse set of data to generate insights relevant to marketing leaders, teams, and functions. We’re looking for someone with the ability to mine various data sets across the company’s data ecosystem, prepare, integrate, and analyze relevant data, and deliver findings through dashboards and presentations. We seek smart, focused, passionate self-starters who bring energy, new ideas and practical experience to a fast-paced and dynamic team, have a bias for action, and care deeply about their customers and each other.

Responsibilities
• Collaborate with assigned marketing teams and business partners to understand their insight needs and translate into reporting/analysis solutions
• Access, extract and curate relevant data for analysis and reporting
• Determine optimal methodology (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive) and apply necessary modeling and statistical analysis approaches/methodologies to generate data results
• Generate insights connecting analytical results with business problems or objectives.
• Collaborate with data and ecosystem owners/SMEs across the organization to implement and optimize data collection tags and analytics tools
• Design and implement automated and actionable dashboards and reports

Education/Qualifications
• Undergraduate degree (Bachelor’s) from an accredited institution in Computer Science, SW Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, IT/IMS, Statistics or other STEM field with a strong quantitative background

Experience/Skills
• 1-3 years of hands-on experience in the analysis, modeling, and visualization of large, complex, and heterogeneous data set
• Experience or knowledge of working with large data sets/ data warehouses, including the ability to extract data from data sets using advanced scripting or SQL
• Experience or knowledge of Data Visualization using Tableau or similar tools
• Experience or knowledge of ETL and/or data prep tools
• Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on design of experiments (A/B testing)
• Strong communicator and experience using data to tell a story
• Attention to detail and results oriented
• Proven ability to take ownership and lead a project with minimal supervision.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with strong written and verbal presentation

Preferred
• Experience in medical diagnostics, pharmaceutical R&D, clinical development and/or healthcare
• Experience with Databricks and/or PySpark
• Experience with Python, R, or SAS to help facilitate predictive analytics
• Expertise in advanced analytics and predictive modeling
• Experience with data science techniques including mathematical and statistical analyses, modeling, and data visualization

Labcorp is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer:

As an EOE/AA employer, Labcorp strives for diversity and inclusion in the workforce and does not tolerate harassment or discrimination of any kind. We make employment decisions based on the needs of our business and the qualifications of the individual and do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy or other medical conditions/needs), family or parental status, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, personal appearance, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristic. We encourage all to apply.

For more information about how we collect and store your personal data, please see our Privacy Statement.

Company Description

Experian unlocks the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We gather, analyze and process data in ways others can’t. We help individuals take financial control and access financial services, businesses make smarter decision and thrive, lenders lend more responsibly, and organizations prevent identity fraud and crime. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done. Our 17,800 people in 45 countries believe the possibilities for you, and our world, are growing. We’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Job Description

Experian India is looking for a Data Analyst to take responsibility of Data Delivery & Management for Experian India’s Data Intelligence team

The Data Intelligence and Data Delivery team is a part of the India HSA which works under strict security protocols for data-management with focus on managing the data processing, analysis, and delivery of client specific requirements in an accurate and timely manner.

The Data intelligence team caters to the following requirements of the Experian India operations:
• Processing of offline deliveries for the Credit services business which contributes to around 45-50% of the revenue of the BU
• Processing of data for a multitude of generic as well as bespoke analytics requirements

What you’ll be doing (Job responsibilities for this role)
• The role requires the person to ensure data accuracy and timely availability of primary data in the core offline delivery systems and manage the engagement with the technology team for ensuring the quality of the data extracted into the offline delivery system.
• Managing increasing escalations from clients on data gaps in the offline processing system requiring investment of quality time to determine the extent of gaps and to work closely with the technology team to fix the same
• Driving automation projects to automate existing data delivery process

You perform tasks to analyze the data, safeguard our data quality and interpret the data in the right way.

Qualifications

What you’ll need to bring along (Your prior experience & Expertise)
• 3-5 years of experience in data-based & operations role (managing Datawarehouse or Big data platform)
• Someone with previous team management experience who was part of business intelligence unit of financial institutions or technology team will be added advantage
• Strong to moderate English communication skill
• Analytical thinking with numerical and data problem solving skills
• Understanding of data, data structures and their value regarding use for analysis, marketing and CRM
• Attention to detail
• Time management to complete multiple tasks to set deadlines

More About You (Skills We Are Looking For)
• Essential: Python and SQL.
• SAS knowledge is added advantage
• Proficiency in making dashboard in Excel

Additional Information
• Helping clients solve complex business problems makes your heart race
• Consulting is most likely in your DNA
• You enjoy working with senior management to set strategic direction
• You are great at defining objectives and approaches for critical assignments.

Why this role is critical to us
• Our business thrives on our ability to leverage data and advanced analytical capabilities, so you’ll have an important mission

Why us
• We’re a high-performance and driven team but we don’t forget to celebrate success
• We invest heavily in our people
• We offer training and support from experienced subject matter experts and managers plus dedicated learning & development time

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Full Job Description
About Flobiz ( Data Analyst )

FloBiz is a neobank for small & medium businesses that aims to accelerate the growth of their enterprises through technology. Founded in 2019 by IIT & BITS alumni, FloBiz is a fintech startup backed by renowned investors like Sequoia Capital India, Elevation Capital, Greenoaks Capital, Beenext and Think Investments. The same team also holds the credit of founding Koinex, India's first & largest peer-to-peer crypto exchange. FloBiz is chasing the mission of digitisation to contribute to the building of an Aatmanirbhar Bharat by solving the most pressing problems of the Indian SMB sector. FloBiz launched its flagship product, myBillBook, in early 2020 and it has become one of the highest-rated business apps in India on the Google Play Store.

About myBillBook

myBillBook is India's leading GST billing & accounting software with mobile, web app & native desktop offerings and runs on Android as well as iOS. myBillBook has been designed to aid SMB owners to conduct their operations from anywhere and anytime and provides a secure platform for business owners to record transactions & track business performance on the go. It is an ideal software for GST registered businesses where invoicing is one of the core business activities. Also, businesses looking to digitise their operations to understand their financial position better can use this software. It helps them create bills (GST & non-GST), record purchases & expenses, manage inventory and track payables/receivables directly from their mobile phones or computers. Also, the app generates 25 critical business reports that help business owners make effective business decisions. myBillBook is currently available in English, Hindi, Gujarati & Tamil.

Currently, the app has been downloaded by over 6.5M SMBs across the country with over 10x growth in user base in the last 12 months alone. Even with such pace of adoption of the product, myBillBook continues to be the highest rated application in its category on Google Play Store.

What makes working at Flobiz Special?

Flobiz is an equal-opportunity employer and values diversity of all kinds at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.We are home to some of the brightest minds when it comes to technology and management. Each individual at FloBiz is an epitome of high ambitions, commitment, talent and an infinite amount of energy all channeled to the cause of Building for Bharat. Culture is at the heart of FloBiz. We are a group of young and energetic professionals with a drive to leave behind an impact. In an attempt to affix ourselves to our roots, we are using the power of technology in chasing the mission of digitisation and to contribute to the building of an Atmanirbhar Bharat and solving the most pressing problems of small and medium businesses in India.We are firm believers of the notion that teamwork with a sense of trust, togetherness, friendliness, playfulness, and loyalty is always 10x more efficient than individual contribution and is a catalyst that fuels the spirit of innovation pushing boundaries & challenges the status quo

Responsibilities

Analyze big data generated by millions of MyBillBook customers and come up with interesting market trends, user behavior patterns, and business insights.

Analyze processes of internal teams with the help of data to optimize their workflow and efficiency.

Work closely with Founders, Product, Sales, Marketing, and other teams to define their analytics strategy and power their day-to-day decisions with the help of data.

Proactively identify new problems with the help of data analytics and communicate them to respective teams for execution.

Work closely with the engineering team to build high-capability analytics infra to power analytics.

Collaborate with multiple teams and identify unique business insights which can help us grow or improve efficiency or refine GTM strategies.

Automate and Productise manual business analytics tasks with the help of No-Code or Inhouse built solutions.

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative disciplines.

2 years of experience in analytics.

Experience in handling and working with big data.

Experience with BI tools like PowerBI, and Tableau.

Intense User research and product thinking capabilities.

Someone with Deep problem-solving capabilities.

Excellent communication and management skills, can work individually with minimal or no supervision.

Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-performance environment.

Strong Knowledge of SQL queries, and working with product analytics platforms like Amplitude.

Nice to have Skills for this role.

Good to have a knowledge of Python

Strong Knowledge of SQL

Strong understanding of analytical tools such as Tableau, PowerBi

Perks @ Benefits

An extensive medical insurance that looks out for our employees & their dependants. We’ll love you and take care of you, our promise

Flobiz Academy: Helps you in terms of Learning and enhancing your skills

Competitive salary

A reward system that celebrates hard work and milestones and Performances throughout the year.

A cool office to make you feel at home. An environment so good that you won't miss your home.

Location.

HSR, Bengaluru ( Currently we are Hybrid )

About Us

Joining Capco means joining an organisation that is committed to an inclusive working environment where you’re encouraged to #BeYourselfAtWork. We celebrate individuality and recognise that diversity and inclusion, in all forms, is critical to success. It’s important to us that we recruit and develop as diverse a range of talent as we can. We believe that everyone brings something different to the table – so we’d love to know what makes you different.

We are/have:

• Experts in banking and payments, capital markets and wealth and asset management
• Deep knowledge of financial services offerings, including e.g., Finance, Risk and Compliance, Financial Crime, Core Banking etc.
• Committed to growing our business and hiring the best talent to help us get there Focused on maintaining our nimble, agile and entrepreneurial culture

Domain: Investment Banking & Capital Market
Experience: 5 to 8 Years
Location: Mumbai / Pune (7 Days travel to Mumbai in a month)

Capco is looking for hardworking, innovative and creative people to join our Business Analyst Team. We are looking for BA to work on all aspects of project delivery engaging complex stakeholder groups across multiple global regions/product lines to execute global change programs in the Investment Banking domain. This includes business analysis, requirements gathering and documentation, driving technical design and specifications in partnership with IT, functional test strategizing and execution, and user acceptance testing coordination. Must possess strong relationship management skills and be able to manage requirements and testing across Ops and IT teams both cross-division and globally. The role is focused on projects to support the development of regulatory/industry-driven changes.

Role Description

• Responsible for performing variety of core BA activities independently e.g., planning the approach, running the requirements gathering sessions, synthesizing information gathered from the requirements sessions in a format appropriate to the intended audience.
• Producing key artefacts at various stages of project life cycle like BRD, FRD, RAID Log and project status reports to senior stakeholders.
• Manipulate, analyze and interpret complex data from trade booking platforms and use technical expertise to document findings in understandable format.
• Establishing data lineage and governance for data to flow accurately and in the required format from source systems to report generation platforms.
• Managing forums like working group, Executive committee or Steer-cos etc.

Skills

• Experience with data related projects would be advantageous, Data mining, identifying and understanding data flows and systems, handling large datasets.
• Process mapping / process enhancement
• Ability to demonstrate instances that they’ve had to document / catalogue process flows (data, system, trade, etc.)
• Process automation projects requiring process mapping skills
• Experience in handling digital transformation/data analytics projects.
• Proficiency in data analytics and visualization tools – Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI and SQL.
• Knowledge and Experience in Data Modelling/Data Lineage and Data Architecture related projects.
• Data Quality and data cleansing techniques.
• Good understanding of Trade related data and reference data for various products within Investment Bank.

Domain and Business Knowledge:

• Process change experience – Agile methodology (Mandatory) and tools
• Domain experience across key business areas – Trade Life cycle, SDLC, Trade Processing, Regulatory Reporting, Collateral Management, Derivatives Operations – at least one
• Critical thinking and ability to anticipate issues & plan stakeholder elicitation sessions
• Related industry & product knowledge
• Other Skills: Communication, Data Analysis, Presentation, Process Development, MS Office. Mastery, Issue Based Problem Solving, Root Cause Analysis, Business Case, Estimation, Scoping

WHY JOIN CAPCO?

You will work on engaging projects with some of the largest banks in the world, on projects that will transform the financial services industry.

We offer:

• A work culture focused on innovation and creating lasting value for our clients and employees
• Ongoing learning opportunities to help you acquire new skills or deepen existing expertise
• A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
• A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture.

Immediate to 30 Days candidates are preferred

The Marketing Operations Data Analyst will support the Marketing Demand Generation team by gathering data, analyzing ad hoc reports, providing quality assurance and investigate data abnormalities. This candidate should be naturally curious about data and large data sets.

As a part of Global Marketing Team, you will be a key contributor to the overall data quality, enrichment of data, segmentation and dispatching leads and contacts in our database. Drive tangible value through campaign specific insights across both Digital and Offline channels.

This position is responsible for the ongoing analysis and improvement of Straive marketing contact database.

· Enhance matching capabilities with third party tool to increase quality of available data

· Conduct data integrity reviews and provide data-driven feedback and recommendations to marketing team.

Job Summary

We are looking for Data Analysts to join our Data Analytics team (offices working in Hybrid model). This is an amazing opportunity to support the team for analysis of Real world data (RWD) by taking individual responsibility of assigned projects. The team consists of around 30 people and the reporting is to the Manager – Data Analytics.

Joining our team of Data analyst/Data scientist, you will support the team for analysis of Real-world data (RWD) by taking individual responsibility of assigned projects. As a member you will be conducting retrospective data analysis including data management and statistical programming as well as the development of RWD dashboards by translating the Methodology into complex algorithms in collaboration with Team.

About you (Skills & Experience Required)
• Bachelor's/Master's degree in computer engineering preferred
• Minimum 3 Years' experience in a Data Analyst role
• Prior work experience in the field of advanced analytics preferably healthcare analytics, IT, consulting and/or business intelligence is preferred.
• Strong problem-solving skills; ability to process complex information, break it into logical steps/tasks and present it clearly to a range of audiences
• Strong on entrepreneurial drive; committed to team and personal development
• Client service and operation mindset
• Strong team player in a dynamic and changing environment; ability to work well with multi-disciplinary teams across continents/time zones
• Strong oral and written communication skills

It would be great if you also had the following:
• Experience working with large databases, data visualization tools, machine learning and statistics preferred
• Knowledge of automation or AI is a plus
• Working knowledge of Tableau, R, Rshiny is a plus

What will you be doing in this role?

You will be staffed on active client engagements focused on health care value with the ultimate goal of making healthcare better, more affordable and more accessible for billions of people around the world.

You will be working on Clarivate data and responsible for analyzing this data using data processing/querying tool like SQL, R or Python. You will collaborate across a broad portfolio of sophisticated commercial analytics projects within data analytics team. This role reports into the Manager – Data Analytics

In this role, you will deliver high-quality analytical outputs to help guide decisions on the business problems for our clients. You will use our proprietary data and analytical platform and will be actively engaged with front-line client teams involved in helping fortune 500 pharmaceutical/payer/Provider to solve their key business questions

Team members will typically use business intelligence, data visualization, query, analytic and statistical software to build solutions, perform analysis and interpret data. Data sources include medical

About the Team

We work with mid-size pharma companies in providing solutions to solve key business questions. We work on the RWD data to calculate Patient, payer, provider level metrics which helps the pharma companies to derive complex business decisions. Our bold mission is to help customers solve some of the world's most complex problems by providing actionable information and insights that reduce the time from new ideas to life-changing inventions in the areas of science and intellectual property. We help customers discover, protect and commercialize their inventions using our trusted subscription and technology-based solutions coupled with deep domain expertise.

Hours of Work

Standard working hrs is 12-9PM IST timings (9 hours per day including 1 hour lunch break).

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

In this role, you will work closely with a team of Data Engineers, in collaboration with the Product & Engineering teams, to implement the entire end-to-end data and analytics workflows on completely cloud-based environments (AWS or Azure), that will support customer objectives. You'll work with some of the brightest minds in the industry, work with one of the richest healthcare data sets in the world, use cutting-edge technology, and see your efforts affect products and people on a regular basis. A Day in the Life Play with and transform data. Work towards creating easy-to-digest analytical reports for US healthcare customers. Design and build interfaces that facilitate workflows between Data Activation Platform and client third party systems as scoped while complying with respective standards and industry best practices. Define and document best practices along with thorough message specifications. Monitor and tune the configuration of interfaces for high availability once deployed in production environments. Understand Innovaccer data warehousing concepts and implement best practices. Work on creating in-house predictive models to forecast medical events. What You Need 4+ years in an analytics role in data services/product firm. Data modeling ability - knowledge of different data modeling concepts. Hands-on experience in creating statistical models; understanding when to use which model to fit the data better. Strong knowledge of SQL and able to write complex SQL queries. Exposure to Python Libraries - Numpy, Scipy, Scikit-Learn. Hands-on experience with BI tools such as Power BI / Tableau / Sisense. Self-starter, curious, accountable, enjoys a healthy level of autonomy, strong work ethic, and success in a fast-paced, high-intensity startup environment. Extensive experience relaying technical and non-technical information clearly and concisely. Demonstrated expert problem-solving and analytical skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Excellence in multitasking and managing multiple high-priority customer engagements at once. Ability to assess complex client environments and workflows and arrive at integration solutions to satisfy seamless experience between our platform and theirs. Ability to mentor junior team members and introduce industry expertise and best practices across integration development. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science. An advanced degree in any of the areas above would be a plus. What We Offer Industry-Focused Certifications: Meet leading healthcare experts, discuss innovative strategies, and become a subject matter expert with our comprehensive set of certifications. Rewards and Recognition: Feeling like you’re outperforming on your projects? Get recognition for your dedicated efforts and demonstrated work ethic. Health Insurance and Mental Well-being: We offer health benefits and insurance to you and your family for hospital-related expenses pertaining to any illness, disease, or injury. We also have Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs) to give you 24X7 access to certified therapists and psychologists. Sabbatical Leave Policy: Do you want to focus on skill development, pursue an academic career, or just reset? We’ve got you covered. Open Floor Plan: Cubicles are a thing of the past and to modernize our office space, we have open floor sittings at every office location. Share ideas with your peers and bond better in an open floor office where there are no barriers and you are inspired to be creative. Paternity and Maternity Leave: Enjoy the industry’s best parental leave policy to welcome your bundle of joy and enjoy quality time with them. Paid Time Off: Maintain a healthy work–life balance and take time off from work to focus on your well-being and big life moments. Full-Time

Twid is backed by leading fintech and loyalty funds and global leaders including Sequoia Surge, Beenext, Rakuten and Google. We are dual headquartered in Singapore and Bangalore.

The role:

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Risk Insights team in Hyderabad, India. This role follows a hybrid approach to working, allowing you to combine working from home with working in our modern offices.
Are you our next star player?

Delivering deep insight and analytics within a fast-paced culture in the world’s largest online gaming company, within a team of outstanding data analysts crafting the future of online gaming through detailed analysis and quality reporting for safer gambling, fraud, customer onboarding, and regulatory departments. Your work will have a tangible impact on our players’ experience and our business direction.

You will bring our extensive data to life, adding insight to key decision-making processes and optimizing our systems to keep our site safe, sustainable, and where the best play.
Who we’re looking for:

An exceptional problem solver and critical thinker who can see the possibility, not just the problem. Someone who can make sense of data so leadership can implement evidence-based, strategically sound decisions. Creative by nature and inquisitive, always seeing the bigger picture. Passionate about visualizing data to be impactful and influential.

If you have a strong command of SQL, knowledge of programming and experience turning complex datasets into actionable recommendations, we encourage you to apply.
Responsibilities:
• Extract data from our databases in various environments (DB2, MS SQL Server and Azure) then process and interpret using statistical techniques in Python and Excel
• Identify patterns and emerging trends with detailed analysis to offer constructive suggestions and estimate the impact their potential impact to customers and business
• Create presentations that synthesize findings from multiple analyses to inform the strategic decision-making of senior leadership

About the organisation

Deutsche Bank’s Operations group provides support for all DB’s businesses to enable them to deliver operational transactions and processes to clients. Our people work in established global financial centres such as London, New York, Frankfurt, and Singapore, as well as specialist development and operations centres in locations including Birmingham, Jacksonville, Bangalore, Jaipur, Pune, Dublin, Bucharest, Moscow, and Cary. We move over EUR 1.6 trillion across the Bank’s platforms, support thousands of trading desks and enable millions of banking transactions, share trades and emails every day.

Our goal is to deliver world-class client service at exceptional value to internal partners and clients. A dynamic and diverse division, our objective is to make sure that all our services are executed in a timely and professional manner, that risk is minimised, and that the client experience is positive. We are proud of the professionalism of our people, and the service they deliver. In return, we offer career development opportunities to foster skills and talent.

We work across a wide range of product groups, including derivatives, securities, global finance and foreign exchange, cash and trade loans and trust and securities services as well as cross-product functions. Operations interface with Regulatory and Tax is a growing area of interest and helps Deutsche Bank to be always compliant.

About Operations Reference Data Services (ORDS)

Operational Reference Data Services (ORDS) function comprises of Client Data, Tax & Regulatory teams (including Instrument Reference Data). The group provides operational services across the Global Markets and Corporate Investment Banking (CIB) clients globally, which enable client business, regulatory and tax compliance, protect against client lifecycle risk and drive-up data standards within the firm. The ORDS function is focused on driving compliance within operations. The primary focus of this Client data, which has a significant impact on how we perform on-boarding and KYC of our customers, maintenance of client accounts and downstream operations.

About the Team

The Client Reference Data Reconciliation team ensures completeness of client records in the authorised client data source within the bank via detective controls. This team is part of the broader Operations Reference Data services. You will be the interface between senior stakeholders, RTB SMEs, IT developers and analytics team to analyse & implement system changes, monitor the JIRA/Incident management and implement transformation initiatives. You will be part of the team that specializes in providing solutions to complex process/applications problems of the division and help extract business intelligence.

Role Description Summary

A Lead Data Analyst within the Change & Transformation team plays a significant role in ensuring projects (change initiatives) meet objectives on time. He/She will focus on leading the data analytics initiative across all the phases- design, development, testing and implementation of data analytics workstream and will primarily be responsible for co-ordinating solution delivery with internal stakeholders and cross functional application leads ensuring overall data quality and efficiency associated with Analytical and Business Intelligence (BI) solutions. He/She will create new data driven approaches for the purpose of generating business insights through data analytics, information visualization and addressing unanswered business issues.

Responsibilities and Tasks
• Responsible for managing the transition of data projects across the department and ensuring accuracy to support business operations and requirements
• Lead data mining and collection procedures. Conducts quantitative, algorithmic, and theory-based analysis for addressing the business issues
• Deconstruct a business problem into multiple logical steps and generating an overall robust analytical solution
• Great execution capability and detail oriented with ability to self-direct work in an unstructured environment
• Be a subject matter expert for specific function understanding basic background of the business and importance of data within the function
• Excellent partnership and collaboration skills with ability to work cross functionally.
• Experiment with new data models and techniques
• Prepare and present to senior stakeholders the overall status, analysis outcome to enable data-driven decision making
• Predict and highlight project RAID and mitigation plan effectively and communicate the status in appropriate forums
• Work effectively under and meet time and schedule constraints.

Experience/skills
• 12+ years of a track record in Data Analytics and Business Intelligence (BI), experience in driving large data projects end to end.
• Displays ability to work in virtual global teams and a matrix organisation and strong quantitative and analytical skills and proven track record of turning large amounts of multifaceted data into meaningful information.
• Experience in designing, developing, and implementing database solutions is a must.
• Advanced knowledge and hands on experience working with SQL, Python/R, Alteryx & visualization tools like Qlik / Tableau.
• Vast experience in data modelling, data analysis and relational database design.
• Party/Client Reference Data domain expertise is preferable.
• Experience in Data Quality projects using any ETL tools.
• Experience in managing the team and deliverables
• Certification in Scrum developer/Alteryx/Tableau or similar is good to have.
• Demonstration of excellent communication skills, influencing and presentation skills, experience in managing Client relationships to drive the change.

We are currently searching for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join the People Analytics team. The candidate should have experience building analytics solutions. They should be comfortable with data visualization tools, aggregating and cleansing data, as well as conceptual Cloud Architecture as they will actively contribute and collaborate to continuously improve the HR Analytics platform. The ability to partner in a matrixed environment and work with the broader HR organization to consistently deliver well thought out solutions will be critical.

• Keep abreast of new and current data visualization trends and technologies
• Provide guidance and support on BI and reporting strategies for different audiences and use cases
• Proactively identify risks and drive action to mitigate and resolve issues, including data quality issues, unsustainable processes, and impact of business process changes to the analytics environment
• Lead analysis, design, development and deployment of dashboards and reports
• Translate business needs into compelling visualizations of KPI trends through iterative design sessions and wireframing
• Collaborate closely with and influence business leaders to assess opportunities and technical solutions for the enterprise
• Develop reusable templates for solving common data visualization needs

Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Data Analytics, Information Management, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent professional experience
• 3-5 years working in Data and Analytics
• 2-3 years working in an Agile methodology/ environment
• Experience with data analytics and visualization packages (Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, etc.)
• Hands-on expertise with big data and/or cloud data warehousing (Redshift, Snowflake, Azure SQL DW, BigQuery)
• Proven ability to query and wrangle disparate data sets together for ad-hoc analysis
• Experience with designing effective exploratory and presentational data visualizations
• Experience interacting with customers and extracting requirements
• Expertise in standards and best practices around data visualization design
• Ability to analyze problems and generate creative solutions for challenging issues
• Solid written and oral communications skills

Preferred Qualifications
• Strong business acumen, critical thinking ability, and attention to detail
• Strong understanding of data visualization development, data analysis process and turning information into actionable insights
• 2-3 years of Python and SQL coding
• Ability to write, enhance and debug code

• Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

We are looking for a data analyst to help us make better business decisions using available data. The candidate would be expected to gather/collate/prepare data from multiple sources either through queries or tools and generate insights on a recurring basis"

Responsibilities
• Understanding the business requirements to formulate the problems and find the right solution.
• Clearly communicating the findings from the analysis to turn information into something actionable through reports, dashboards, and/or presentations.
• Performing cleansing, processing, and validation on the data subject to analyses, to ensure its quality.
• Performing basic analysis and converting raw data into pivot tables in Excel for better reading of data.
• Building queries and analyses on Reporting tools like AWS Quicksight or Redash.

Requirements
• 1-2 years of hands-on experience in data analytics.
• Education background with a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Information Management, Data Analytics or any suitable background is preferred.
• Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
• Strong experience and knowledge of SQL and the ability to work with and join multiple queries.
• Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data cleanup, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
• Experience in handling reporting packages and databases like PostgreSQL, SQL server.
• Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel to be used for data set analysing.

At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation. We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment. Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.

Job Opportunity/Description

TITLE: Data Analyst

LOCATION: Bangalore

DEPARTMENT: Global Engineering Operations (GEOps)

REPORTS TO: Bangalore GEOps Manager & Engineering Applications Manager

Job Summary

The Business Analyst will support analytics insights and reporting efforts for Global Engineering Operations at Polaris. The expectation is to go beyond traditional analytics reporting and provide/present actionable insights, and to facilitate change and improve the business. Key responsibilities include ongoing delivery of reporting and insights, problem-solving and analysis, and supporting Lead Analysts and the BI team to deliver solutions that improve business performance. Work and collaborate cross-functionally with the GEOps BI team (includes taking direction from and working in partnership with Lead Data Analysts), business stakeholders and leads, the Digital & IT / Data Science team, and the peer Data Analyst network across the organization.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
• Support process improvements or automation for the Engineering Operations PowerBI dashboard suite and other analytics solutions – from creation and deployment to implementation of automated maintenance, and delivery of ongoing improvements and enhancements.
• Support a data-driven plan to measure and improve Global Engineering Operations analytics maturity spanning product development and management data, part and BOM data, project financials and planning data, validation data, and new data needs as the business evolves (e.g., Program Health, Predictive Modeling, Quality, Resource Management, etc.).
• Perform day-to-day platform operations activities for Snowflake, Alteryx, and PowerBI.
• Execute ongoing controls to ensure data security and integrity.
• Execute ongoing controls to minimize technical risk and eliminate manual data maintenance.
• Perform data cataloging efforts to support enterprise analytics documentation.
• Support ongoing and ad-hoc analytic requests, providing accurate and timely data, analysis, and insightful interpretations to provide value-add solutions to internal customers.
• Explore, extract, cleanse and combine data from multiple sources and systems – independently grow understanding of the business context.
• Collaborate cross-functionally to gather requirements, design and execute a solution end to end.
• Design and develop new dashboards and reports in PowerBI to facilitate storytelling and promote design thinking in the development process.
• Build and publish visualizations supporting measurement of outcomes related to the analytical projects.
• Demonstrate passion for learning and implementing new BI and AI technologies and share knowledge with peers, the BI team, and GEOps internal customers.

Support Lead Data Analysts to execute the following essential work, and other duties as assigned:
• Support IT and project Data Engineers to analyze, design, build, query, troubleshoot and maintain data pipelines.
• Ability to effectively foster business relationships across teams (e.g., business teams, interactive group, project management, business intelligence, etc.) and develop a good view of how the business operates so that analytical results can be framed in a business context.
• Collaborate with the broader analytics community to grow knowledge and skills and assist in troubleshooting issues with self-service tools.

Skills & Knowledge

Required technical skills and experience:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Computing and Information Systems, Computer Science or related field.
• 2+ years of work experience in an analytics, data integration and visualization-focused role.
• 2+ years of experience with data mining/visualization/predictive modeling tools: SQL, PowerBI, Alteryx, Snowflake, SSMS, etc.
• 2+ years of experience interfacing directly with business users of analytics platforms.
• 1+ years of experience in languages like SQL, Python, Scala.
• 1+ years of experience with data preparation, visualization, and processing from a diverse set of data sources.
• Experience with data documentation/cataloging tools and strategies.
• Knowledge of data engineering principles and best practices.
• Experience performing root cause analysis and troubleshooting technical issues.
• Strong working knowledge of MS Office applications.

Preferred Technical Skills And Experience
• Developing in the Microsoft stack (SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS).
• Knowledge of statistical methods and predictive/analytical modeling techniques and practices.

Required Interpersonal Skills
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with team members and work cross functionally with the larger organization – proficient in English.
• Able to work independently and as an active member of a team.
• Naturally curious problem solver with experience working in an Agile environment.
• Creative, innovative, decisive, and prone to action. Quality and customer focused.
• Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented work environment.
• Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills with minimal supervision.

Working Conditions
• Flexible hours required to participate in meetings with global team.

We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE. Apply today!

About Polaris

As the global leader in Powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. With annual 2021 sales of $8.2 billion, Polaris’ high-quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER®, RZR® and Polaris GENERAL™ side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman® all-terrain off-road vehicles; Indian Motorcycle® midsize and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot® moto-roadsters; snowmobiles; and deck, cruiser and pontoon boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with parts, garments, and accessories, along with a growing aftermarket portfolio. Polaris’ presence in adjacent markets includes military and commercial off-road vehicles, quadricycles, and electric vehicles. Proudly headquartered in Minnesota, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe. www.polaris.com

About This Opportunity

The Global Marketing Data Analyst would be primarily responsible for developing and delivering a reliable and scalable reporting solution that will enable Align finance user groups to migrate to the next generation of Align’s reporting platform. The data analyst will be reporting to the Director Business Analytics based in San Jose, California (US) and would strategically engage with key members of finance and marketing function defining and delivering on the enterprise roadmap projects as well as own and help resolve day to day tactical problems and challenges. This position will involve identifying reporting efficiencies, automating opportunities ranging from data extraction to analytics, and implementing next generation dashboard & visualization tools to meet business reporting needs. The role will ensure use of business intelligence applications’ best practices, enhancing business decision making and reporting capabilities.

In this role, you will…

As part of the finance global marketing reporting team, main responsibilities would primarily involve the following:
• Assist the team on analytics visualization roadmap projects in developing and maintain intuitive and easy to use reports & dashboards that ensures data accuracy and consistency in reporting.
• Work with the team in building the dataset models to support on-going and new Finance and Marketing projects. Duties would include data validation, testing, report development and all pre-production support activities.
• Provide support for all the existing reports and work on report enhancements based on direction from the Global team lead.
• Would be involved in the documentation of all the report inventory for finance and marketing.
• Development & support of business intelligence reporting solutions using Power BI and other Microsoft enabled tools to enhance the level of reporting capabilities within the finance organization.
• Assist with special projects and ad-hoc requests, as necessary.

In this role, you’ll need …
• Requires Bachelor’s degree in CS, Information Technology, or a related field, with experience developing & administering BI solutions.
• Should be a self-starter who is able to work with minimal direction and exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.
• This dynamic role will require the candidate to work on problems of a diverse scope and manage their own time to successfully complete assigned tasks by either required dates or self-prescribed due dates.
• The candidate will serve as a liaison between the marketing user group, corporate report development team, and IT.
• Should be a team player and possess good interpersonal and communication skills, reflecting an ability to be patient and outgoing with people.
• Should be highly motivated, result focused, and act with a high sense of urgency.
• Should possess excellent planning and prioritization skills with the ability to multitask and maintain by adapting to change.

Required Experience
• Should be proficient with Excel and have the ability to independently create spreadsheets to reconcile data and perform quantitative analysis on data.
• Should possess strong SQL skills to run adhoc queries on data models.
• Must have the ability to independently create spreadsheets to reconcile data and perform quantitative analysis.
• Should have or demonstrate the aptitude to build datasets and develop visualization/dashboards in Microsoft Power BI.
• Needs strong analytical and problem-solving skills to understand business report issues and help to map these issues into reporting solutions.

Good To Have
• Experience building & maintaining financial dashboards using will be considered a plus.
• Prior experience or exposure to Power BI, Tableau or Azure Finance datalake will be considered a plus.

job_title: Product Engineer I - Matching/ Data Analyst
job_description:
Company Description

Experian unlocks the power of data to create opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We gather, analyze and process data in ways others can’t. We help individuals take financial control and access financial services, businesses make smarter decision and thrive, lenders lend more responsibly, and organizations prevent identity fraud and crime. For more than 125 years, we’ve helped consumers and clients prosper, and economies and communities flourish – and we’re not done. Our 17,800 people in 45 countries believe the possibilities for you, and our world, are growing. We’re investing in new technologies, talented people and innovation so we can help create a better tomorrow.

Job Description

Experian India is looking for a Java Developer and Data Analyst to join Credit Bureau technology team. The candidate would possess a strong analytical mind, be a technical and creative thinker, have a strong aptitude for problem solving, and have zero tolerance for inefficiencies in software development. The ideal candidate will have excellent written, oral and interpersonal communication skills, along with the fervent desire to continuously learn about different products and technologies.

What You’ll Need To Bring To The Party
• Attract, develop and retain an effective, diverse workforce of talents to oversee IT projects and ensure successful development and implementation of new systems.
• Someone with a good 3 to 5 years of experience as an Analyst developer.
• Oversee and manage budgets with optimum allocation and utilization of technology resources and talent.
• Analytical mindset and enjoys learning & solving complex problems.
• Collaborate with teammates inspecting and adapting everything within the system
• We are looking for an individual who is energetic, engaged, and willing to actively participate with the right positive attitude.

What You’ll Be Doing
• You will be a part of the matching and development team who is responsible for analyzing the data and suggest solution to achieve desired outcome.
• You will also be working on development of application using Java technologies.
• The role involves foster teamwork follow through on commitments and ensure all stakeholders are appropriately informed on the status of projects, problem resolution and any technology or billing related changes.
• Oversee and manage budgets with optimum allocation and utilization of technology resources and talent.
• Ensure compliance with IT policies, methodologies and strategies.
• Manage issues proactively including timely resolution and the identification of remediation opportunities.

More About You
• Comprehensive knowledge of information technology more specifically around domains on application development and cybersecurity
• Primary Skills required – Analytical Skills, ability to analyse, model and interpret huge amounts of data, good at data analysis and exploration
• Expert on platforms like SQL / Hive, Excel & R or Python
• Sound knowledge on statistical analytical techniques and predictive analysis, Helping develop reports and dashboards.
• You should have fair experience working on Java Web Services: SOAP & REST. Experience with XML and JSON and Familiarity with Source Control Tools (Bitbucket, Git) & Containers and Microservices Architecture and Cloud services (AWS preferred)
• You should have hands on experience on with at least one Database (DB2, Oracle, Mongo DB, Cassandra etc.)

Why this role is critical to us
• The position requires someone responsible for analyzing the data and suggest solutions to achieve the desired outcome.
• This position will ensure that technology strategies are well-coordinated and fully supporting the development of products, and growth within channels and lines of business.

Why us
• We’re a high-performance and driven team but we don’t forget to celebrate success
• We offer strong career and international opportunities for high performers
• We invest heavily in our products and our people
• We offer training and support from experienced subject matter experts and managers plus dedicated learning & development time

Additional Information

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Senior Data Analyst
• Develop and implement data collection systems and strategies to optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
• Perform data cleaning and data manipulation tasks to ensure data accuracy and completeness
• Analyze and interpret complex data sets, identify trends and patterns, and provide insights and recommendations to the business
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics and KPIs that align with business goals and objectives
• Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate insights and findings
• Identify opportunities to automate and streamline data processes to increase efficiency and accuracy
• Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and reporting techniques

Requirements
• Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
• 5-7 years of experience in data analysis or related field
• Strong analytical skills and the ability to work with large, complex datasets
• Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
• Experience with statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms is a plus
• Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to effectively communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
• Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision

(ref:iimjobs.com)

Job Opening - Associate Data Analyst/Data Analyst

Experience Required - 1-2 years (Associate Data Analyst)/3-5 Years (Data Analyst)

Shift - Day

Working Style - Hybrid

The Opportunity

The Data Analyst will work as a part of the Supplier IO Data Operations team and will be responsible for studying, gathering, and analyzing data from various databases and sources. He/she must develop reports, summaries, and visual representations and is responsible for the implementation and delivery execution of supplier.io’s products and services to customers, and the data governance and maintenance of supplier.io’s master database. The Data Delivery Specialist function is responsible for preparing, processing, auditing, and verifying data delivered to customers.

What You Will Do
• Responsible for secondary and primary research, collecting data from different sources and data analysis of cross industries and company
• Research and analysis in cross industries domain and analyze Suppliers details
• Create/Update US/Global Data as per the client requirements adhering to the Client Needs..., accomplished through secondary research.
• Collect & Analyze the data ( Locations & Contacts ) collected from different sources (like Websites, LinkedIn, ZoomInfo, Hoovers, Insideview, Xing and other ) along with source link for future reference.
• Intermediate skillset in excel, in using various function, Documentation skills.
• Create and maintain Excel worksheets, web tools to ensure accurate, centralized client data needs.
• Perform research on companies to ensure the quality of supplier.io’s master database.
• Research and decide which data source is correct when two or more data sources have different information for the same data point.
• Perform quality assurance checks on data supplier.io and prepares for customer deliverables.
• Understand and collect data as per the requirements & ensure data process is configured according to customer requirements.
• Performs quality assurance audits on data results ensuring proper data formatting, data content, and customer requirements are met.
• Utilize various software packages and tools for collecting and reporting data.
• Must demonstrate strong analytical, problem identification and problem resolution skills.
• Ability to apply existing analytic methods and tailor to client needs.
• Must be an excellent team player, as well as be self-directed.
• Must have the ability to work independently and manage communications up and down.
• Ensure confidentiality, timeliness, and accuracy in the analysis of all related data activities.
• Executes the data process, audits each step, and prepares data files, including Excel reports using formulas and templates.
• Assist with troubleshooting and resolving data issues identified by internal project managers and/or clients.
• Document client’s custom processes to ensure proper steps are executed during next scheduled data process.
• Document and share data product issues/errors with Data Management team and/or Product team to ensure proper resolution is identified and implemented.
• Cleansing and De-duping Data for Data Quality, Data analysis and research, Formatting data and consolidation

What You Will Need to Succeed
• Bachelor of Engineering / Bachelor of Technology or Master’s in Science / Bachelor of Science with Computers.
• 1-2 years (Associate DA) or 3-5 Years (DA) work experience in data analysis / research (Primary & Secondary Research).
• Research data from Web and other available platform’s, different sources (like Websites, LinkedIn, ZoomInfo, Hoovers, Insideview, Xing and other )
• 2-4 years of experience in Excel, Using formula functions. Proficient in MS Office
• Knowledge in any RDBMS - SQL Server (Optional).
• Knowledge in any ETL/ Reporting tools (Optional).
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Ability to interpret and handle data. Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
• Excellent team player abilities with good interpersonal and behavior skills
• Flexibility to work in shifts. (India / UK Hours)

Job Description

Highlight Top / Key Responsibilities for this position
• Proactively create costed bill of material reports by sales order line for regions where FTAs exist (continually review of backlog and upcoming requirements).
• Determine sales order and line qualifications via use of controlled processes and communicate results
• Solicit and manage country of origin declarations from suppliers each year, track request date and received date, ensure country of origin certificates are received, track effective dates and request updated or new certificate when required.
• Manage and maintain COO share point
• Respond to customer requests for certificates
• Prepare certification documentation for signature by global trade manager
• Work with suppliers of purchased raw material to determine if they can support FTA requirements
• Solicit Country of Origin Declaration from Suppliers. If Country of Origin is U.S. or OTHER FTA country (Australia, Chile) request US/FTA Declaration, where applicable. Solicit COO each year and retain declarations. Retain
• Country of Origin Declaration in Purchasing Supplier folder and a copy on Reno Microsoft Team Site in Supplier Folder.
• Determine Sales Order Line item requires Free Trade Agreement Qualification. Requirement may come from Customer email or run Reno Backlog Report from BI Reports.
• Create Costed bill of Material Excel Sheet from SAP ERP System. Report is US Multiple BOM Report enhanced by I.T. based on requirements needed for the FTA Qualification
• Create Costed bill of Material Excel Sheet from SAP ERP System. Report is US Multiple BOM Report enhanced by I.T. based on requirements needed for the FTA Qualification
• Liaison between the customer and the plant- so for example Australia and/or Chile would contact them for required qualifications and needed certs Determine Single Value Cost where applicable

Review any change in Procurement/Manufacturing (e.g., Supplier, Cost, Origin, Bill of Material), update as needed.

Review Costed Bill of Material Excel Sheet for any errors that may Impact FTA qualifications. When Costed Bill of Material Excel Sheet is completed, load into Reno's Microsoft Team Site. Notify Purchasing to Review.

On Costed Bill of Material Excel Sheet, add 7 New Columns for US/[Country] Certificate, Date Requested, Date Received, Originating , Non-Originating, Self-Produced and De Minimis to create a Free Trade Agreement Qualification Worksheet.

Review Certificate of Origins from Suppliers. Update Certificate from Supplier Y or N, Date Requested, Date Received.

Identify which Free Trade Agreement (US-Australia or US-Chile) is applicable for Sales Order Line Item. This is determined based on if sales order is shipping to Australia or Chile. On Free Trade Agreement Qualification Worksheet, insert Rows 6 to 60 of either Australia or Chile Formula Worksheet to document Buildup Method/Builddown Method, Regional Value Content Information, Definitions, General Notes of Free Trade Agreement used in qualification process. Australia Formula Worksheet and Chile Formula Worksheet are included in this workbook, see sheet tabs.

Fill in FTA Qualification Date, Final Product Part Number, Final Product Common English Name, Final Product Assigned HTS Number. (Trade Compliance will complete Criterion and Regional Value Content)

See Rules of Origin Section of Formula Worksheet. Identify Final Product Assigned HTS Number. For each BOM component part HTS that is not in final product HTS sub-heading, put BOM line item single unit value in "Originating" Column. Any HTS at BOM line item level that has a tariff shift from component part HTS to final product assigned HTS number would go in "Originating". If no tariff shift, if U.S. Origin and FTA Declaration obtained from Supplier, put in Originating. If no declaration, then put in Non-Originating even if U.S. Origin.

Add Sub-Total Formulas in highlighted cells copied from Formula Worksheet. Insert Fixed Labor, Direct Labor, Overhead (Var & Fixed), Adjusted Value (Selling Price) from Costed Bill of Material Excel Sheets. Add Formula from Formula Worksheet to determine profit. Check Subtotals and Totals to ensure formula correct. Add Formula to get totals for Originating, Non-Originating, Self-Produced and De Minimis. Check Totals to ensure formula correct.

Complete RVC calculation using RVC Formula on Formula Worksheet. Complete both Build-up method and Build-down method RVC calculation. When Free Trade Agreement Qualification Worksheet is completed, load into Reno's Microsoft Team Site. Notify Trade Compliance. Desired Educational Qualification Successful applicants will be bright, highly motivated individuals that love a challenge and have an enthusiastic interest in process improvement. The successful candidate will demonstrate the following skills and qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering
• Proficient with SAPGT system to generate costed bill of material reports in excel
• Proficient with Excel to add formulas, macros where needed instead of doing manual entry to the costed bill of material
• Project oriented to solicit and manage country of origin declarations from suppliers each year, track request date and received date, ensure certificates are received, track effective dates and request updated or new certificate when required. Technical Skills / Knowledge Required 1. Excel / Advance Excel
• Macros

Knowledge of SAP GT

Description:

Join GlobalLogic, to be a valid part of the team working on a huge software project for the world-class company providing M2M / IoT 4G/5G modules e.g. to the automotive, healthcare and logistics industries. Through our engagement, we contribute to our customer in developing the end-user modules’ firmware, implementing new features, maintaining compatibility with the newest telecommunication and industry standards, as well as performing analysis and estimations of the customer requirements.

Requirements: Business Analyst Requirements:
• A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA.
• A minimum of 06+ years of relevant experience in business/data analysis or a related field.
• Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
• The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
